aws::graph::propositions: Factors Affecting Amazon.com's Business Performance
Amazon.com's business is affected by online commerce.
Amazon.com's business is affected by cloud services.
Amazon.com's business is affected by new technologies.
Amazon.com's business is affected by emerging technologies.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the amount Amazon.com invests in new business opportunities.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the timing of investments in new business opportunities.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the mix of products sold to customers.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the mix of services sold to customers.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the mix of net sales derived from products compared with services.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the extent to which Amazon.com owes income taxes.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the extent to which Amazon.com owes other taxes.
Amazon.com's business is affected by competition.
Amazon.com's business is affected by management of growth.
Amazon.com's business is affected by potential fluctuations in operating results.
Amazon.com's business is affected by international growth.
Amazon.com's business is affected by international expansion.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the outcomes of claims.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the outcomes of litigation.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the outcomes of government investigations.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the outcomes of other proceedings.
Amazon.com's business is affected by fulfillment optimization.
Amazon.com's business is affected by sortation optimization.
Amazon.com's business is affected by delivery optimization.
Amazon.com's business is affected by data center optimization.
Amazon.com's business is affected by risks of inventory management.
Amazon.com's business is affected by variability in demand.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the degree to which Amazon.com enters into commercial agreements.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the degree to which Amazon.com maintains commercial agreements.
Amazon.com's business is affected by the degree to which Amazon.com develops commercial agreements.
Amazon.com's business is affected by proposed acquisitions.
Amazon.com's business is affected by completed acquisitions.
Amazon.com's business is affected by strategic transactions.
Amazon.com's business is affected by payments risks.
Amazon.com's business is affected by risks of fulfillment throughput.
Amazon.com's business is affected by risks of fulfillment productivity.
Global economic conditions may give rise to many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Global economic conditions may amplify many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Global geopolitical conditions may give rise to many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Global geopolitical conditions may amplify many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Additional unforeseen circumstances may give rise to many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Additional unforeseen circumstances may amplify many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Unforeseen developments may give rise to many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Unforeseen developments may amplify many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Unforeseen events may give rise to many of Amazon.com's business risks.
Unforeseen events may amplify many of Amazon.com's business risks.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/

text: online commerce, cloud services, and new and emerging technologies, the amount that Amazon.com invests in new business opportunities and the timing of those investments, the mix of products and services sold to customers, the mix of net sales derived from products as compared with services, the extent to which we owe income or other taxes, competition, management of growth, potential fluctuations in operating results, international growth and expansion, the outcomes of claims, litigation, government investigations, and other proceedings, fulfillment, sortation, delivery, and data center optimization, risks of inventory management, variability in demand, the degree to which we enter into, maintain, and develop commercial agreements, proposed and completed acquisitions and strategic transactions, payments risks, and risks of fulfillment throughput and productivity. In addition, global economic and geopolitical conditions and additional or unforeseen circumstances, developments, or events may give rise to or amplify many of these risks.
